chunks.text: Next question is what is product of A and B?
A multiplied by B
So how to calculate product of two numbers?
Like math has sum and product, same way Java has sum and product
Here instead of multiplying we put asterisk in Java
So first we have to make our scanner object
Then we will take input A using sc.next int
Then we will take input B using sc.next int
Then we will take product of both of them and make a variable
Integer type of product is equal to A multiplied by B
And finally we will print the value of our product
So we have to write the same code as we wrote for sum
Here instead of sum we will take product
And instead of plus we will write multiply and print the same product
Now let's write code directly for this
In fact, let's change our old code
For us, the scanner line will be constant
We have to take input A and B
But this time we don't have to calculate sum
This time we have to do int product is equal to A multiplied by B
So this is the same asterisk sign which we used earlier
As soon as we use this, we get the product
Means A multiplied by B will be calculated first
And then it will be stored in the product
And now we will print the product
So let's save it and run it
So first of all, we enter A, we enter 10
We enter B, we enter 5
And what is the product? 10 multiplied by 5 which is equal to 50

full_text: Next question is what is product of A and B? A multiplied by B So how to calculate product of two numbers? Like math has sum and product, same way Java has sum and product Here instead of multiplying we put asterisk in Java So first we have to make our scanner object Then we will take input A using sc.next int Then we will take input B using sc.next int Then we will take product of both of them and make a variable Integer type of product is equal to A multiplied by B And finally we will print the value of our product So we have to write the same code as we wrote for sum Here instead of sum we will take product And instead of plus we will write multiply and print the same product Now let's write code directly for this In fact, let's change our old code For us, the scanner line will be constant We have to take input A and B But this time we don't have to calculate sum This time we have to do int product is equal to A multiplied by B So this is the same asterisk sign which we used earlier As soon as we use this, we get the product Means A multiplied by B will be calculated first And then it will be stored in the product And now we will print the product So let's save it and run it So first of all, we enter A, we enter 10 We enter B, we enter 5 And what is the product? 10 multiplied by 5 which is equal to 50
